title: Otillio1330
author: Otillio1330
created_time: June 29, 2023, 11:15:56 PMLast edit: June 30, 2023, 12:42:34 AM by Otillio1330
content: Hello, everyone. Todamant, and I have discovered, or maybe it was already known, an interesting issue regarding privnote. I sent him a btc address on privnote to make a payment for some cards. The address I sent is not the address he received. So I double checked and sent the same address to myself through privnote, and what I received is not what I entered. I have done this now with multiple wallet addresses, every time the decrypted privnote gives a different address than what you put in.  Todamont  has confirmed the same thing happens when he does it with a wallet address as well. I dont know why I sent Todamont my address on privnote, as I have never done that before. I may have just been tired. But the loss on this is minimal, and if I can keep someone else from making this mistake I’d be happy about it. Anyway you guys try it out and confirm, or let me know just how dumb I am for not already knowing this.

comments.author: rsincognito
comments.body: Wow,  doesn’t that mean it has to be an inside job from the people that developed the website ?

comments.author: Otillio1330
comments.body: Also this may not belong in collectables, but it’s the only part of the forum I frequent. Sorry if it needs to be moved.

comments.author: YodasRedRocket
comments.body: Sure you’re not using the scam site privnotes ?

comments.author: Kryptowerk
comments.body: Holy chickens.I remember something like this happened before and it was related to a scam site with a similar name.If this is the real privnote.com it's either an inside job and the whole thing is compromised or a hack.Thanks for the info, I'll try it out right now.Quote from: YodasRedRocket on June 29, 2023, 11:35:05 PMSure you’re not using the scam site privnotes ?Edit: Yes exactly that's was the name of the scam site that does this to BTC addresses.

comments.author: minerjones
comments.body: This is why I have been using zerobin.net  and even more so, just use PGPEasy enough to sign up at https://keybase.io/

comments.author: blucepheus
comments.body: Check your browser history to confirm which site you used. I just tried the legit privnote and it worked fine.

comments.author: Otillio1330

It’s privnote.co  Haha fuck they got me. Yep I’m an idiot. Thanks guys!

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.created_time: June 29, 2023, 11:53:30 PMLast edit: June 30, 2023, 12:05:10 AM by PX-Z
comments.body: Quote from: Otillio1330 on June 29, 2023, 11:43:19 PMHey man I just double checked it. It’s privnote.co  Haha fuck they got me. Yep I’m an idiot. Thanks guys! Damn! I'm sure you clicked the google sponsored ad on google search instead the legit site when searching "privnote". Are you using a mobile phone? Or desktop one. I suggest you to use ad blocker on desktop browsers and use firefox/brave or other browser that has built-in ad blocker.Also, bookmark the site if possible.Edit: reported the site to google.

comments.author: Todamont
comments.body: So Otillio1330 lost his bitcoin payment because GOOGLE served him an ad to a crypto scammer site???I tested it, it's privnote.co that is mangling the addresses, another scam site.Wow. Seems like there could be recourse for a small-claims case against Google, to me. Doesn't that make them accessory to the scam???

I've seen the same tactic employed in the NFT space, where a paid ad sent people to a BS version of an NFT trading site. People lost their bored apes over this when they were worth $300-400K.

comments.author: montreal1
comments.body: Used privnote plenty before and never had an issue. Will need to be safer and up my game though. Thanks for sharing

comments.author: aoluain
comments.body: Quote from: Todamont on June 30, 2023, 12:10:34 AMSo Otillio1330 lost his bitcoin payment because GOOGLE served him an ad to a crypto scammer site???I tested it, it's privnote.co that is mangling the addresses, another scam site.Wow. Seems like there could be recourse for a small-claims case against Google, to me. Doesn't that make them accessory to the scam???I would say that would be a long, tedious drawn out endeavour.I have seen this happen before and even brought it to the communities attention here,Google was serving a promoted advert for a fake Trezor web address. I wonder howmany people got burned with that one?Just goes to show Google do not have the proper checks in place to protect us fromthese scams. very worrying.

comments.author: krogothmanhattan
comments.body: This is scary indeed. Anytime I need to do any type of large transaction I send thru two different channels.  For example....send once thru privnote say thru forum PM and then send a regular email or even thru discord or any other channel.   Compare the two addys and they should match. Then I would proceed with said transaction.

comments.author: ChiBitCTy
comments.body: Quote from: Otillio1330 on June 29, 2023, 11:18:58 PMAlso this may not belong in collectables, but it’s the only part of the forum I frequent. Sorry if it needs to be moved. It’s collectible related. When posts like this come up, I will usually post on two boards. Like I will post the main thread on here then in the scam section I’ll write something in the title like “Fake Privnote website once again” and then in the body of the post I’ll just write “see original post here” and provide a link. Sometimes posts should be in two places, and moderators have always been fine with it when it makes sense. I remember when this happened originally. It popped up on google before the real site. These scammers are pretty decent. Have you checked any of the address just to see how much money they’ve stolen so far? I’d be curious to see those addresses.

comments.author: krogothmanhattan
comments.body: Quote from: ChiBitCTy on July 01, 2023, 07:01:47 PMQuote from: Otillio1330 on June 29, 2023, 11:18:58 PMAlso this may not belong in collectables, but it’s the only part of the forum I frequent. Sorry if it needs to be moved. It’s collectible related. When posts like this come up, I will usually post on two boards. Like I will post the main thread on here then in the scam section I’ll write something in the title like “Fake Privnote website once again” and then in the body of the post I’ll just write “see original post here” and provide a link. Sometimes posts should be in two places, and moderators have always been fine with it when it makes sense. I remember when this happened originally. It popped up on google before the real site. These scammers are pretty decent. Have you checked any of the address just to see how much money they’ve stolen so far? I’d be curious to see those addresses.    I went ahead and used this site and gave the following addy.....see from pic below....you can see what I placed and what was give are not the same just as OP mentioned.      Here is the balance of the one they gave https://blockchair.com/bitcoin/address/bc1q50r0529jkml7hlswcfj5av2wgqc3efpc35c3wm      I tried another yesterday and it was zero balance....so I guess sometimes they generate a new address.                 Also years ago there was another site impersonating privnote.....here is an article.   https://www.hackread.com/fake-version-note-sharing-site-privnote-com-steale-bitcoin/    Again...I say....I would send the btc addy to the person using two different channels.....     Example....if you want to use privnote that is fine and send thru forum. But I would also use another service totally different and send thru an email...discord or twitter...email...etc etc etc. Then I would compare the addys.    Another way.....if for any high amount...send $10 in BTC...confirm it has arrived then once that is done, send the rest.
